title: Tracking Issue for aligning Unicode version to 15.0 (year 2022)

labels.name: C-tracking-issue
labels.description: Category: A tracking issue for an RFC or an unstable feature.

body:
Unicode is released on a yearly basis, so we update the data files we used accordingly after each Unicode release in the Rust project. (Keep in mind that new dependencies might be added over time.)

### About tracking issues

Tracking issues are used to record the overall progress of implementation.
They are also used as hubs connecting to other relevant issues, e.g., bugs or open design questions.
A tracking issue is however *not* meant for large scale discussion, questions, or bug reports about a feature.
Instead, open a dedicated issue for the specific matter and add the relevant feature gate label.

### Steps
Goal: Unicode 15.0 (year 2022)

####  Unicode version dependent crates:
#####  Libraries
- [x] Updating `libcore`:  #101821

##### Compiler
- [x] Verify whether each crate is Unicode version dependent and add support for the new Unicode version in compiler dependency libraries
- [ ] Bump dependencies and ensure updated version is used in `Cargo.lock`
  - [x] #101912
###### Language integrated:
  - [x] `unicode-xid` (Decide whether it's a valid identifier)
         Current: 0.2.2 (Unicode 13)
         Goal: 0.2.4 (Unicode 15)
  - [x] `unicode-normalization` (Preprocess identifiers for equality)
         Current: 0.1.13 (Unicode 9)
         Goal: 0.1.22 (Unicode 15)
  - [x] `unicode-security` (Decide whether lints against unwanted usages should be triggered)
         Current: 0.0.5 (Unicode 13)
         Goal: 0.1.0 (Unicode 15)
  - [x] `unicode-script` (Used by `unicode-security` for script detection)
         Current: 0.5.3 (Unicode 13)
         Goal: 0.5.5 (Unicode 15)

###### Diagnostics:
  - [x] `unicode-width` (used by `rustc-parse`, `rustc-errors` and many others)
         Current: 0.1.8 (Unicode 13)
         Goal: 0.1.10 (Unicode 15)
  - [ ] `unic-char-property` (used by `unic-emoji-char`, then `rustc-lexer`)
         Current: 0.9.0 (Unclear, No release in 2 years)
         Goal: Need a new release
  - [ ] `unic-char-range` (used by `unic-emoji-char`, then `rustc-lexer`)
         Current: 0.9.0 (Unclear, No release in 2 years)
         Goal: Need a new release
  - [ ] `unic-common` (used by `unic-emoji-char`, then `rustc-lexer`)
         Current: 0.9.0 (Unclear, No release in 2 years)
         Goal: Need a new release
  - [ ] `unic-ucd-version` (used by `unic-emoji-char`, then `rustc-lexer`)
         Current: 0.9.0 (Unclear, No release in 2 years)
         Goal: Need a new release
  - [ ] `unic-emoji-char` (used by `rustc-lexer`)
         Current: 0.9.0 (Unclear, No release in 2 years)
         Goal: Need a new release
  - [ ] `unic-langid` (used by \[`rustc_error_messages`, `rustc_macros`, `fluent-*`, `intl*`\], then `rustc-lexer`)
         Current: 0.9.0 (Unclear, No release in 2 years)
         Goal: Need a new release
  - [ ] `unic-langid-impl` (used by `unic-langid`)
         Current: 0.9.0 (Unclear, No release in 2 years)
         Goal: Need a new release
  - [ ] `unic-langid-macros` (used by `unic-langid`)
         Current: 0.9.0 (Unclear, No release in 2 years)
         Goal: Need a new release
  - [ ] `unic-langid-macros-impl` (used by `unic-langid`)
         Current: 0.9.0 (Unclear, No release in 2 years)
         Goal: Need a new release
##### Dev-Tools:
- [x] Verify whether each crate is Unicode version dependent and advocate support for the new Unicode version in dependency libraries
- [ ] Bump dependencies and ensure updated version is used in `Cargo.lock`

###### Dependency crates:
  - [ ] `unicode-bidi` (used by `idna` then `url` then \[`ammonia`, `cargo`, `cargo-test-support`, `clippy_lints`, `crates-io`, `git2`, `git2-curl`, `rustc-workspace-hack`\])
         Current: 0.3.4 (Unicode 10)
         Goal: Need a new release.
  - [x] `unicode-segmentation` (used by `rustfmt`)
         Current: 1.9.0 (Unicode 14)
         Goal: 0.10.0 (Unicode 15)
  - [ ] `unicode_categories` (used by `rustfmt`)
         Current: 0.1.1 (Unclear, No release in 6 years)
         Goal: Need a new release
  - [ ] `unicase` (used by `pulldown-cmark`, then \[`rustdoc`, `clippy-lints`, `mdbook`\])
         Current: 2.6.0 (Unclear, No release in 3 years)
         Goal: Need a new release
####  Unicode version independent crates (ignorable for now, just for future reference):
  - [x] `unicode-bdd` (in-tree maintainence tool): Unicode version independent
  - [x] `ucd-parse`: Unicode version independent (used by `unicode-bdd` tool)
  - [x] `ucd-trie`: Unicode version independent (used by `handlebars`, then `mdbook`)
